markdown.markdown: My name is **Conor English**, and I’m a Business Studies student with a strong focus on analytics. I’m passionate about working as a **data analyst in elite sports environments**, particularly in **player recruitment** for professional teams in football, the NFL, or the NBA. I created this e-portfolio to showcase my capabilities across data analysis, machine learning, dashboarding, and SQL-driven insights, all applied through realistic, industry-inspired scenarios. # 🎓 Academic & Technical Background I’m studying **Business Studies** at Dublin City University with a specialism in **Analytics**, where I've completed modules in **machine learning, data management, and statistical modeling**. In addition to my degree, I’ve earned multiple certifications in **Python, Machine Learning, and SQL** through **DataCamp** and **Kubicle**. ### 🧰 Tool Proficiencies Python SQL Jupyter Power BI Excel Matplotlib Seaborn Git VS Code Quarto # 🎯 Career Goals My ultimate aim is to contribute to **data-driven decision-making in professional sports**, particularly focusing on identifying undervalued and emerging talent and supporting long-term recruitment strategies. I’m continually learning how to build models, manage large datasets, and extract actionable insights while also improving in areas like **data cleaning, storytelling, exploratory analysis**, and **model validation**. # 🤝 Collaboration & Soft Skills Throughout my degree, I’ve participated in several **collaborative, long-term group projects**, including full-year assignments. These experiences have sharpened my abilities in: - **Communication** – actively listening, contributing effectively in teams - **Teamwork** – navigating deadlines and sharing responsibilities - **Problem-Solving** – tackling ambiguity and applying critical thinking ::: {.callout-note} These soft skills are just as important as technical tools. Working closely with peers has taught me to communicate clearly, resolve conflicts, and deliver quality work in a team setting essential for real-world analytics roles. ::: # 💬 Final Thought > **“Data will never replace intuition—but it can sharpen it.”** > Blending instinct with insight—for better decisions on and off the pitch.
